citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Fish and Game (ADF&G), Division of Commercial Fisheries, Management and Development Division
citeinfo.title: Alaska Department of Fish & Game: Summary of the Mandatory Shellfish Observer Program Database

descript.abstract: The observer program database contains information collected by biologist placed on board commercial crabbing vessels in the Bering Sea and the Aleutians. The observer program was implemented in 1988 and continues to the present. The database contains fishery efforts, catch abundance and composition profiles and species biological characteristics. The database is updated annually.
descript.purpose: Observers deployed on board commercial crabbing fishing vessels provide ADF&G with database of fishery statistics and species biological characteristics that provide insights to better fisheries management strategies and augment understanding of how the commercial fisheries may impact the Bering Sea ecosystem.

idinfo.accconst: State of Alaska protects confidentiality of fisheries information linked to individual participants
idinfo.useconst: State of Alaska protects confidentiality of fisheries information linked to individual participants

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
